sections.heading: Overview
content:
Ruth S. Jacobowitz is a women's health advocate, lecturer, and author of
five women's health books that help women take the pause out of menopause and
the change out of change of life. Her books include The Estrogen Answer
Book: 150 Most-Asked Questions About Hormone Replacement Therapy; 150
Most-Asked Questions About Midlife Sex, Love, and Intimacy: What Women &
Their Partners Really Want to Know; 150 Most-Asked Questions About
Osteoporosis; and 150 Most-Asked Questions About Menopaus e. She
was the only lay speaker invited to the World Congress on Fertility and
Sterility in Montpelier, France, where she spoke to physicians about women's
perspectives on hormone replacement therapy.

Jacobowitz has been featured in many newspapers and magazines. She has also
appeared on National Public Radio's "All Things Considered" and many
other programs, including "48 Hours," "The Today Show," and
"CBS This Morning." She writes two columns for Your Health
Magazine -- "Woman-To-Woman" and "Sexuality: His, Hers, and
Theirs" (co-written with Ken Goldberg, MD). She also writes the "Focus
On Health" column in the Chagrin Valley Times in Cleveland,
Ohio.
Jacobowitz also serves on the editorial review board of the newsletter Women's Health Advocate
